description: Conversion of a single family dwellinghouse into five self-contained residential units (1 x 2 bed; 4 x 1 bed); single storey and part two storey rear extension; associated internal and external alterations; and provision of associated amenity space; cycle and refuse storage; and car parking
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990.

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s):8WOLV-SPLP01 rev 01 (dated 29May2020) (site, block+location plan); 8WOLV-PP01 Draft Rev 02 (dated 29May2020) (proposed floor plans and elevations); 8WOLV-PS01 Rev 01 (dated 29May2020) (section drawing)
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.
| All external materials to be used in the development shall match those of the existing building unless indicated on the approved plans or application form.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 & 7.6 of the London Plan (2016); Draft New London Plan(2019) policies D1 and D4 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).
| The proposed rooflights hereby approved shall not project more than 150mm from the roof plane and shall be retained as such for the lifetime of the development

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 & 7.6 of the London Plan (2016); Draft New London Plan(2019) policies D1 and D4 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).
| No part of the flat roofs of the hereby approved development shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof terrace/garden or similar amenity area.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties and future occupiers of the development, in accordance with policies 7A  and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013); Draft New London Plan(2019) policies D1 and D4 and policy 7.6 of the London Plan (2016).

| Prior to occupation of the development, an enhanced sound insulation value DnT,w [and L'nT,w] of at least 5dB above the maximum Building Regulations value, for the floor/ceiling /wall structures separating different types of rooms/ uses in adjoining dwellings, namely bedroom adjacent to staircase, living/dining room and kitchen above/below bedroom of separate dwellings shall be implemented and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with Policies 3.5 and 7.15 of the London Plan 2016, policy D6 of the Draft New London Plan(2019)-intend to publish;  policies 1.1(j) & 1.2(f) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) and with policies 3.5 and 7A of the Ealing's Development Management Plan Document.

| The residential units hereby approved shall at no time be converted from C3 residential to a C4 small HMO, notwithstanding the provisions of Schedule 2 Part 3 Class L of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 (or any order revoking and re-enacting that Order) without express planning permission having first been granted by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: : To prevent the overdevelopment of the site and to safeguard the living conditions of adjoining properties and visual appearance of the building, in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 and of the London Plan (2016) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).
| The rear garden shall not be subdivided and shall remain as a shared space for all flats for the lifetime of the development.

Reason: To maintain the prevailing character and setting for rear gardens in the Creffield Conservation Area and in general,  as one whole plot for the benefit and enjoyment of all occupants of the new flats and to prevent patchwork maintenance of rear garden plots in accordance with the NPPF(2019), and policies 7.4 of the London Plan(2016) and Ealing's Development Management DPD policy 7.4 and 7C and the Creffield Conservation Area.

| Prior to occupation of any flats hereby approved,  forecourt planting, to comprise biodiverse plants and an ornamental tree, shall be planted at a proportion of fifty percent of the forecourt.  Any planting that is part of the approved scheme that within a period of five years after planting is removed, dies or becomes seriously damaged or diseased, shall be replaced in the next planting season and all planting shall be replaced with others of a similar size and species and in the same position, and shall be retained thereafter.

Reason:  To ensure a satisfactory standard of appearance and setting for the development and to ensure that the proposed development enhances the visual amenity of the Creffield Conservation Area; and in the interests of the amenities of the occupants of the development  in accordance with policies 5.10, 7.4, 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 and of the London Plan (2016), the London Environment strategy (2018) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).
| At least 9 secure cycle parking spaces shall be provided within the rear outbuilding and shall be retained thereafter.

The rear outbuilding shall only be used for purposes incidental to the enjoyment of the development hereby approved, and shall not be used or adapted for habitable accommodation as an independent dwelling or any industrial, commercial or business use.

Reason:  To encourage sustainable transport modes and to ensure that the development does not detract from the amenity of the adjoining properties, and to enable the Local Planning Authority to retain control over the use of the building in accordance with London Plan (2016) policy 6.9 and table 6.3; Draft New London Plan(2019)-intend to publish policies T5 and table 10.2 ,D1 and D4 ; and policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4, 7B & 7C of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 & 7.6 of the; and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).

| Prior to occupation of the flats, a discreet timber screened refuse storage facility to accommodate bins for recycling and non- recycling shall be provided for all flats within the property with capacity in compliance with BS5906:2005, and retained thereafter.

Reason: To ensure a satisfactory standard of appearance and setting for the development and to ensure that the proposed development enhances the visual amenity of the locality, in the interests of the amenities of the occupants of the development in accordance with policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013)
